Class MazeLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • MazeLogic

  • public class MazeLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    A class with only static methods and variables that is used for the logic of a maze

    • Field Summary

      private static Position[] movements
      An array of all possible movements (up, down, left, right)

      • MazeLogic

    • Method Detail

      • mazeTraversal

        public static boolean mazeTraversal(char[][] maze,
                                    Position position)
        A recursive method that is used to traverse a maze. When the method is called the current space on the map is made an 'x', this shows that we have been here. The maze is then printed and traversal starts. The way traversing starts is that the movements array is iterated through to check for possible positions to move to. When a possible position is found the recursive call is made and then the process is done over and over. Dead end paths that are found are marked by '0's.
        Parameters:
        maze - The maze that is being traversed
        position - The current position
        Returns:
        A boolean if there is an ending to the maze.

      • print

        private static void print(char[][] maze)
        The method used for printing the maze to the console
        Parameters:
        maze -
